question_text: Which scenario would justify disabling hardware acceleration in video driver settings?
answer_options: The screen is dim and hard to read
Text appears too small on a high-res display
Display flickers or shows artifacts during animation or playback
The screen does not fill the monitor area completely
correct_answer: Display flickers or shows artifacts during animation or playback
explanation: Hardware acceleration improves performance but can cause stability issues with some drivers or displays, resulting in flickering or artifacting. Disabling it can help diagnose or resolve these symptoms.
